definition: to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Then he came back over here, and cried, easily, for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 後來他又返回那兒，放聲大哭，足足哭了兩個小時。

sentences.english: And then I fled back to my car, sat in the front seat and burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 接着我逃回車上，坐在前面的座位上，放聲大哭。

sentences.english: I once walked past the young child of a script supervisor, and he burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 有一次我從編劇的小孩面前走過，他立刻放聲大哭。

sentences.english: Fan Chin's mother and wife burst into tears.
And she put down the candle and the jug, and sat herself down and began a-crying.
sentences.chinese: 她放下蠟燭和酒罐，坐下來放聲大哭。

sentences.english: When Chou Chin awoke and saw where he was, he cried loudly and struck his head on the plate again.
sentences.chinese: 誰知周進睜眼看見號板，放聲大哭，又一頭撞去。

sentences.english: With tears in her coat she burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 她上衣有裂口，便放聲大哭了起來。

sentences.english: Then the master stumbled out of the door of the cottage and fell to his knees, weeping helplessly.
sentences.chinese: 然後他跌跌撞撞地走出農舍，跪倒在地，放聲大哭。

sentences.english: I curled up on the floor and cried.
sentences.chinese: 我蜷縮在地上然後放聲大哭。

sentences.english: My father cried and hugged me.
sentences.chinese: 父親也抱住了我，放聲大哭。

sentences.english: He was very emotional; he cried when I left.
sentences.chinese: 他很易動感情，我走時他放聲大哭。

sentences.english: The depression comes cannot from already when, I am met oneself burst into tears after fuddle .
sentences.chinese: 壓抑至無法自已的時候，我會把自己灌醉後放聲大哭。

definition: gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
